entries.title: Tech stocks just finished a five-week rally — the longest stretch since market peak in Nov. 2021
entries.description: Cost cuts have replaced growth on Wall Street's checklist, and tech executives are being celebrated for efficiency over innovation.

entries.title: Hong Kong is giving away 500,000 flights this year—here’s what to know
entries.description: On Thursday, Hong Kong's leader John Lee announced the city is giving away 500,000 flights in an effort to revive its economy after strict pandemic policies.

entries.title: China's suspected spy balloon prompts Blinken to postpone Beijing trip as Congress seeks answers
entries.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken will postpone his trip to China next week after a suspected Beijing-operated spy balloon looming over parts of Montana.

entries.title: Payrolls increased by 517,000 in January, crushing estimates, as unemployment rate hit 53-year low
entries.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 187,000 in January, according to Dow Jones estimates.

entries.title: Samsung exec says he wouldn't give a smartphone to his daughter until she was 11
entries.description: Plenty of parents are giving their children phones before then, according to a 2021 study by review site Common Sense Media.

entries.title: Treasury yields leap after much hotter jobs report than expected
entries.description: U.S. Treasury yields jumped up Friday following strong jobs data.

entries.title: Some of Wall Street's biggest names are exposed to the Adani Enterprises plunge
entries.description: Shares of India's Adani Enterprises have plummeted over the past week after the publication of an extensive critical report from U.S. short-seller Hindenburg Research.

entries.title: China tells U.S. to remain 'cool-headed' over suspected spy balloon
entries.description: Foreign Ministry spokesperson Mao Ning said at a press briefing that authorities were still learning about the matter.

entries.title: Bill Gates says Elon Musk's ambition to colonize Mars is not a good use of money
entries.description: In an interview with the BBC, Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates questioned whether Musk's vision of colonizing Mars was a good use of money.

entries.title: World's biggest pension fund posts loss in longest losing streak in two decades
entries.description: A sharp drop in the value of the U.S. dollar against the yen weighed on the value of Japan's Government Pension Investment Fund's foreign assets.

entries.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley's frustration builds as he vows to transform the automaker
entries.description: CEO Jim Farley wants Ford to become a far more efficient company, and he needs it to happen quickly.

entries.title: China's real estate crisis isn't over yet, IMF says
entries.description: China needs to do more in order to fix its real estate problems, the International Monetary Fund said Friday.

entries.title: Blackouts, currency dives and corruption: Pakistan's economy is on the brink of collapse
entries.description: Pakistan's foreign currency reserves are so depleted it has only enough to pay for roughly three weeks of imports.

entries.title: There's a buzz about green hydrogen. But pink, produced using nuclear, may have a huge role to play too
entries.description: CNBC's Sustainable Future takes a look at the emerging pink hydrogen sector and the role it could play in the planet's shift to a low-carbon future.

entries.title: Chinese Tesla rival Xpeng launches flagship EVs in Europe in international push
entries.description: Xpeng, a Chinese electric vehicle startup, launched its P7 sedan and its G9 sports utility vehicle (SUV) in Denmark, Norway, the Netherlands and Sweden.

entries.title: Europe is set to ramp up its oil war against Russia — and markets are bracing for more disruption
entries.description: It is thought that the EU's forthcoming embargo on Russian petroleum products will be both more complex and more disruptive than what has come before.

entries.title: Sanctions on Russian crude oil have 'failed completely,' oil analyst says
entries.description: Sanctions imposed on Russian crude oil have so far have "failed completely" and new price caps could prove immaterial as well, analysts told CNBC.

entries.title: S&P Dow Jones is knocking Adani Enterprises off its sustainability index
entries.description: Adani Enterprises will be removed from the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices, effective Feb. 7, S&P said in an announcement.

entries.title: Hong Kong will give away half a million plane tickets. Here's who can get them first
entries.description: The "Hello Hong Kong" campaign, launched Thursday, will offer 500,000 free air tickets over the next six months, starting in March.

entries.title: Apple telegraphed that things are getting better after a tough quarter — here's how to interpret its remarks
entries.description: Here's how to interpret Apple financial chief Luca Maestri's directional insights from the company's quarterly earnings call.

entries.title: China's Tencent wants to expand its presence in Singapore — and Chinese tourists are a big reason
entries.description: "We see Singapore as a strategic market for Weixin," Etienne Ng, Southeast Asia's regional director for Tencent's Weixin Pay, told CNBC in an email.

entries.title: Google CEO promises new AI features are coming to search 'very soon' amid competition from ChatGPT
entries.description: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai talked up the company's artificial intelligence projects during its Q4 2022 earnings call.
